pc:dimension.pc:description: X coordinate as a long integer. You must use the scale and offset information of the header to determine the double value.
pc:dimension.pc:name: X

pc:dimension.pc:description: Y coordinate as a long integer. You must use the scale and offset information of the header to determine the double value.
pc:dimension.pc:name: Y

pc:dimension.pc:description: Z coordinate as a long integer. You must use the scale and offset information of the header to determine the double value.
pc:dimension.pc:name: Z

pc:dimension.pc:description: The intensity value is the integer representation of the pulse return magnitude. This value is optional and system specific. However, it should always be included if available.
pc:dimension.pc:name: Intensity

pc:dimension.pc:description: Return Number: The Return Number is the pulse return number for a given output pulse. A given output laser pulse can have many returns, and they must be marked in sequence of return. The first return will have a Return Number of one, the second a Return Number of two, and so on up to five returns.
pc:dimension.pc:name: ReturnNumber

pc:dimension.pc:description: Number of Returns (for this emitted pulse): The Number of Returns is the total number of returns for a given pulse. For example, a laser data point may be return two (Return Number) within a total number of five returns.
pc:dimension.pc:name: NumberOfReturns
